summary: This document is an index of records withheld in full by the Bureau of Prisons in response to a FOIA lawsuit by The New York Times. It lists 60 categories of documents related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration, his apparent suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, and his death by suicide on August 10, 2019, all withheld under various FOIA exemptions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) whose apparent suicide attempt and subsequent death are the subject of all withheld documents.

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: Recipient of a letter dated August 14, 2019, and a memo dated August 13, 2019, mentioned in the context of withheld correspondence about Epstein's death.

persons.name: Unit Manager
persons.context: Author of a memo dated August 10, 2019, which is listed among the withheld documents.

events.title: Epstein's Apparent Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein reportedly attempted suicide while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). This event generated numerous incident reports, photo sheets, memos, and investigative documents.

events.title: Epstein's Death by Suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in his cell at the MCC. The event triggered a massive internal investigation, psychological reconstruction, and generated thousands of pages of withheld records.

events.title: Monitoring and Logs Prior to Death
events.description: The day before Epstein's death, overtime logs, assignment rosters, TRUINTEL reports, and other monitoring documents were created, all of which are withheld.

events.title: TRUINTEL Report Creation
events.description: A TRUINTEL report (an intelligence report) was generated a year after Epstein's death, included in the withheld materials.

keyFacts: The Bureau of Prisons is withholding a vast trove of documents (at least 60 distinct categories) related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death under FOIA exemptions 5, 6, 7(A), 7(C), 7(E), and 7(F).
Documents pertain to two key incidents: an 'apparent suicide attempt' on July 23, 2019, and Epstein's death by suicide on August 10, 2019.

Withheld materials include sensitive internal records: psychological reconstructions of the death, staff overtime logs, inmate assignment rosters, investigative reports, photo evidence, medical/psychological records, and thousands of internal emails.
The index reveals extensive post-death investigations and internal reviews, including responses to the psychological reconstruction and TRUINTEL (intelligence) reports.
The document is part of a lawsuit, New York Times v. BOP (20 Civ. 833), indicating media efforts to obtain these records which the government claims are exempt from disclosure.
